| A pseudodragon:* has no hands.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* can be [tamed by feeding](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic").
* wanders randomly.
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                   |

A **pseudodragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [dragon-like](/index.php?title=Dragon_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") creature that has several stages of growth. Pseudodragons have a tendency to wander, will pick up [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A pseudodragon has a bite attack and a weak [breath weapon](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon") similar to that of [half-dragons](/wiki/Half-dragon "Half-dragon").

## Generation

Pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [tiny pseudodragon](/wiki/Tiny_pseudodragon "Tiny pseudodragon") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a pseudodragon, and a pseudodragon can grow up into a [riding pseudodragon](/wiki/Riding_pseudodragon "Riding pseudodragon").

## Origin

Pseudodragons originate from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Pseudodragon_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

html:
Pseudodragon (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
D pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks Bite 1d6 physical, Breath weapon 1d2 half-dragon breath
D pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Bite 1d6 physical, Breath weapon 1d2 half-dragon breath

Base level 4
Base experience 63
Speed 14
Base AC 4
Base MR 1
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 150
Nutritional value 150
Size small

A pseudodragon:

  • has no hands.
  • is carnivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • wanders randomly.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A pseudodragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a carnivorous and domestic dragon-like creature that has several stages of growth. Pseudodragons have a tendency to wander, will pick up gold and gems, and can be seen via infravision.

A pseudodragon has a bite attack and a weak breath weapon similar to that of half-dragons.

Generation

Pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A tiny pseudodragon can grow up into a pseudodragon, and a pseudodragon can grow up into a riding pseudodragon.

Origin

Pseudodragons originate from Dungeons & Dragons, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''pseudodragon''', {{brown|D}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a [[carnivorous]] and [[domestic]] [[Dragon (dNetHack)|dragon-like]] creature that has several stages of growth. Pseudodragons have a tendency to wander, will pick up [[gold]] and [[gem]]s, and can be seen via [[infravision]].

A pseudodragon has a bite attack and a weak [[breath weapon]] similar to that of [[half-dragon]]s.

==Generation==
Pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [[tiny pseudodragon]] can [[grow up]] into a pseudodragon, and a pseudodragon can grow up into a [[riding pseudodragon]].

==Origin==
Pseudodragons originate from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.
